column1: A mineral is a naturally occurring chemical compound. Most often
column2: they are crystalline and abiogenic in origin. A mineral is different from a rock
column3: which can be an aggregate of minerals or non-minerals and does not have one specific chemical composition
column4: as a mineral does. The exact definition of a mineral is under debate
column5: especially with respect to the requirement that a valid species be abiogenic
column6: and to a lesser extent with regard to it having an ordered atomic structure.The study of minerals is called mineralogy. There are over 5
column8: 070 of these have been approved by the International Mineralogical Association (IMA). The silicate minerals compose over 90% of the Earth's crust. The diversity and abundance of mineral species is controlled by the Earth's chemistry. Silicon and oxygen constitute approximately 75% of the Earth's crust
column9: which translates directly into the predominance of silicate minerals.
